title: NDTV News-World-news
description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

entries.title: China Congratulates PM Modi For Poll Win, Says "Ready To Work"
entries.description: China on Wednesday congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi following his election win, adding it was "ready to work" with its neighbour.

entries.title: Village Massacred By Nazis To Be Preserved As Reminder Of War Atrocities
entries.description: A French village preserved as a reminder of Nazi cruelty since Waffen-SS troops murdered 643 people there in 1944 is in danger of decay, sparking efforts to preserve the site.

entries.title: 9 Soldiers Injured After Explosion At Israeli Military Base
entries.description: Nine Israeli soldiers were injured, two of them seriously, when ordnance exploded at a military base in the south, the army announced on Wednesday.

entries.title: Singapore's Only Heavy Metal Bar Rocks "Something Else"
entries.description: Tucked away in the basement of an old mall lies gleaming Singapore's only heavy metal bar, where music fans brush shoulder-to-shoulder with international rockers who helped pioneer the genre.

entries.title: Elon Musk's X Updates Content Policies, Officially Allows Porn. Details Here
entries.description: Elon Musk's social media platform X, formerly Twitter, has officially announced a shift in its content policies, now permitting pornographic material.

entries.title: Around 25 People, Who Were On Cruise, Mysteriously Fall Sick On US Flight
entries.description: Emergency medical personnel from the Houston Fire Department checked on three of the passengers upon the plane's landing but none of them needed hospitalisation.

entries.title: There Are Over 22 Million Millionaires In The World, An All-Time High
entries.description: The world has never had so many rich people and their investments in soaring stock markets have made them wealthier than ever recorded, according to a study published on Wednesday.

entries.title: Ex Meta Employee Fired Over Content Linked To Israel's War In Gaza: Report
entries.description: A former Meta engineer on Tuesday accused the company of bias in its handling of content related to the war in Gaza, claiming in a lawsuit that Meta fired him for trying to help fix bugs causing the suppression of Palestinian Instagram posts.

entries.title: Tunisia's Muslims Turn To AI To Save Age-Old Islamic Texts
entries.description: In an unassuming house on the Tunisian island of Djerba, Said al-Barouni embarked on a mission to safeguard his Muslim community's little-known heritage, using technology and AI to save age-old religious manuscripts.

entries.title: 17th Century Artwork, Looted By Nazis, Returned To Jewish Family
entries.description: Two 17th-century paintings looted by the Nazis and kept at the Louvre in Paris after the war have finally been returned to their Jewish owners, who then donated them back to the museum.

entries.title: Kanye West Sued Over Sexual Harassment, Wrongful Termination By Ex-Assistant
entries.description: She says she was purposely caused mental suffering and is now owed $3 million as compensation for breach of contract and hostile work environment.

entries.title: Will Ensure "Porn-Free" Mode On X Platform: Elon Musk
entries.description: As social media platform X allowed users to post adult and graphic content earlier this week, its owner Elon Musk on Wednesday said he would ensure a porn-free' experience for those who do not want to watch such content.

entries.title: High Profile Accounts, Including CNN, Face Cyberattack: TikTok
entries.description: TikTok on Tuesday said it slammed the door on a cyberattack that targeted high-profile accounts including CNN.

entries.title: Former British Navy Officer Arrested In Dubai For Spying
entries.description: Matt Croucher, a former British Royal Marine who served in Iraq and Afghanistan, has been held in Dubai for seven months on spying charges, the Times newspaper said on Tuesday.

entries.title: US Man, Who Killed Popular Colombian DJ, Gets 42 Years In Jail
entries.description: An American man was sentenced to 42 years in prison in Bogota on Tuesday for the murder of a famous Colombian DJ, in a case that drew international outrage from women's rights activists.

entries.title: Hubble Space Telescope, Launched In 1990, Will Ease Into Retirement
entries.description: The venerable Hubble Space Telescope, which has revolutionized astronomical discovery since its launch in 1990, will ease into retirement with a scaled-back observing schedule, NASA officials said Tuesday.

entries.title: US House Passes Bill To Sanction International Criminal Court Over Israel
entries.description: The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives passed legislation that would impose sanctions on the International Criminal Court over its prosecutor's decision to seek arrest warrants for Israeli officials related to the war in Gaza.

entries.title: Google's Privacy Chief To Exit
entries.description: Google's chief privacy officer, Keith Enright, will leave the company this fall, after 13 years at the tech giant, a spokesperson for the Alphabet-owned company said on Tuesday.

entries.title: Trump Asks Judge To Lift Gag Order From Hush Money Criminal Trial
entries.description: Donald Trump has asked a judge to lift the gag order imposed on him during his New York criminal trial, which saw him become the first convicted former US president, according to a filing released Tuesday.

entries.title: US Commends India's Parliamentary Elections, Stays Neutral On Results
entries.description: The US on Tuesday praised India's parliamentary elections as the "largest exercise of democracy in history", while refraining from commenting on the outcomes of the polls.
